messages.content: ComfyUI-Gemma is a custom node or plugin for ComfyUI that integrates the Gemma model.
To install ComfyUI-Gemma, you need to download the Gemma model from Kaggle at https://www.kaggle.com/models/google/gemma.
What environment variables need to be set for installing ComfyUI-Gemma?
To install ComfyUI-Gemma, you need to export your Kaggle username and token to the environment variables KAGGLE_USERNAME and KAGGLE_KEY.
What Python code can be used to download the Gemma model weights?
To download the Gemma model weights, you can use the following Python code: `import kagglehub; VARIANT='7b-it-quant'; weights_dir = kagglehub.model_download(f'google/gemma/pyTorch/{VARIANT}')`
What are the available variants of the Gemma model?
The available variants of the Gemma model are: '2b', '2b-it', '7b', '7b-it', '7b-quant', and '7b-it-quant'.
Where can I find the basic workflow for using ComfyUI-Gemma?
The basic workflow for using ComfyUI-Gemma can be found in the provided image at https://github.com/chaojie/ComfyUI-Gemma/blob/main/workflow.json.
Is ComfyUI-Gemma a standalone application or a plugin?
ComfyUI-Gemma is a custom node or plugin that extends the functionality of ComfyUI by integrating the Gemma model.
